bugs.title: CVE-2020-25725 xpdf: sending crafted a PDF document to the pdftops tool could result in DoS

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2020-25725 xpdf: sending crafted a PDF document to the pdftops tool could result in DoS

long_desc.thetext: In Xpdf 4.02, SplashOutputDev::endType3Char(GfxState *state) SplashOutputDev.cc:3079 is trying to use the freed `t3GlyphStack->cache`, which causes an `heap-use-after-free` problem. The codes of a previous fix for nested Type 3 characters wasn't correctly handling the case where a Type 3 char referred to another char in the same Type 3 font.

Acknowledgments:

Name: Mike Zhang (Pangu Lab)

External References:

https://forum.xpdfreader.com/viewtopic.php?f=3&t=41915

Created xpdf tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-6 [bug 1899523]
Affects: epel-7 [bug 1899522]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1899521]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2020-25725 xpdf: sending crafted a PDF document to the pdftops tool could result in DoS

long_desc.thetext: In Xpdf 4.02, SplashOutputDev::endType3Char(GfxState *state) SplashOutputDev.cc:3079 is trying to use the freed `t3GlyphStack->cache`, which causes an `heap-use-after-free` problem. The codes of a previous fix for nested Type 3 characters wasn't correctly handling the case where a Type 3 char referred to another char in the same Type 3 font.

Acknowledgments:

Name: Mike Zhang (Pangu Lab)

External References:

https://forum.xpdfreader.com/viewtopic.php?f=3&t=41915

bugs.title: CVE-2020-35376 xpdf: stack consumption due to an incorrect subroutine reference in a Type 1C font charstring

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2020-35376 xpdf: stack consumption due to an incorrect subroutine reference in a Type 1C font charstring

long_desc.thetext:
Xpdf 4.02 allows stack consumption because of an incorrect subroutine reference in a Type 1C font charstring, related to the FoFiType1C::getOp() function.

Reference:
https://forum.xpdfreader.com/viewtopic.php?f=3&t=42066

Created xpdf tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-7 [bug 1911351]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1911350]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.
